title: JP Morgan Sues Tesla for More Than $162 Million
summary: Bank alleges breach of contract involving stock warrants; CEO unloads another $930 million of shares. Elon Musk's wave of Tesla Inc. share sales continued into a second week, with the car maker's chief executive on Monday unloading more than 934,000 shares valued at around $930 million, while also exercising stock options, according to new disclosures.

title: Twitter CFO Says Investing in Crypto 'Doesn't Make Sense Right Now'
summary: Ned Segal sees social-media company's subscription revenue growing. Investing some of Twitter Inc.'s corporate cash in crypto assets such as bitcoin "doesn't make sense right now," Chief Financial Officer Ned Segal said in an interview Monday.

title: Kyle Rittenhouse Homicide Trial Wraps Up
summary: Jury is set to start deliberating the teenager's case on Tuesday. Prosecutors and defense attorneys on Monday offered starkly different portraits of Kyle Rittenhouse, the teenager charged in the killing of two people during unrest in Kenosha, Wis., last year, in closing arguments before the judge sent the high-profile case to the jury.

title: The Elizabeth Holmes Trial: Texas Investor Emerges as Complicated and Fiery Witness for Both Sides
summary: Alan Eisenman invested about $1.2 million in blood-testing startup and lost it all. SAN JOSE, Calif.-Theranos Inc. investors included a roster of celebrity-caliber business moguls, wealthy families and government figureheads. Alan Eisenman isn't one of those people.

title: America Will Be Number One-in Taxes
summary: The House-Biden plan will give the U.S. the highest combined federal and state top tax rate among major nations.. Americans like to be first-in Olympic gold medals, for example-but maybe not in this category: If the $4 trillion House spending bill passes, the U.S. will have the highest combined federal and state personal income tax rate in the developed world.

title: 'We Want Them to Go Bankrupt'
summary: Biden's nominee for Comptroller has an idea on climate change.. Saule Omarova continues to make the case against her nomination to be Comptroller of the Currency, as critics need only to quote her own words. The latest example is a video interview she gave in February in which the Cornell professor opined on "the case for a U.S. national investment authority."

title: Louisiana's Tax Reform Breakthrough
summary: The state cuts tax rates in return for closing a distortionary deduction.. Even in this polarized era, tax reform can be bipartisan. See Louisiana, where voters on Saturday approved a constitutional amendment that will reduce corporate and individual income tax rates while simplifying the code.

title: Biden vs. California
summary: Labor Secretary Walsh does a favor for his pals in the Teamsters.. Here's another reason for Democratic moderates to oppose the $4 trillion spending bill: It will give progressives more leverage to bully their states. Behold how President Biden's Labor Department is using federal transit funds to extort California Gov. Gavin Newsom.

title: Who Stole Americans' Confidence in Elections?
summary: The Clinton campaign and Stacey Abrams spread falsehoods about vote theft years before Trump's loss.. I'm mostly known for standing up for the integrity of Georgia's November 2020 elections. I spent months debunking conspiracy theories, refuting lies about our voting procedures, and enduring threats because I refused to bend on the facts.

title: Israel Is at the Center of a New International Security Order
summary: An alliance that spans from the U.S. through Europe to India is emerging to combat belligerent actors in the Middle East.. Jerusalem

title: How to Become Calm in America
summary: Avoid politics and social media. Play a sport, listen to music, maybe even start a business.. I was walking in a New York suburb when I came across a sign saying "Traffic Calming Ahead." The sign, which means that the street has speed bumps to slow traffic, struck me as odd for two reasons. First, one or two speed bumps won't cause "traffic calming." Drivers will slow down for a few seconds, then speed back up. Second, I think of calm as a word that describes the sea or one's state of mind-not traffic.

title: Book Review: 'Rigged' and 'Our Broken Elections'
summary: Voting fraud happens, but is it 'massive'? Mollie Hemingway and others weigh in with new books.. Seventy-five percent of Republican voters say the 2020 election was "rigged," per a recent poll, with "real cases of fraud that changed the results." Are they right? From the title of Mollie Hemingway's book, "Rigged," you'd think it would be easier to figure out. The prologue is titled "You're Not Wrong." She quotes President Trump saying he was "cheated" and that "it hurts to lose less than to win and have it taken away."

title: Notable & Quotable: The OSHA Vaccine Mandate
summary: 'The Mandate's strained prescriptions combine to make it the rare government pronouncement that is both overinclusive . . . and underinclusive,'. Judge Kurt D. Englehardtwriting for a three-judge panel of the Fifth U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in a Nov. 12 order staying enforcement of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Covid-19 vaccination mandate:

title: The COP26 Summit and the Global Age of Shams
summary: The intellectual and political disarray on display in Glasgow was terrifying.. If there is one thing the world should take away from the Glasgow COP26 summit, it's that the most dangerous greenhouse-gas emissions come from the front ends of politicians, not the back ends of cows. Pandering is much more dangerous to human civilization than methane, strategic incompetence a graver threat than CO2; and dysfunctional establishment groupthink will likely kill more polar bears than all the hydrofluorocarbons in the world.

title: Milton Friedman Laughs Last
summary: The monetarist 'isn't running the show anymore,' the 46th president said in 2020. Would that he were.. "Milton Friedman isn't running the show anymore."

title: Biden Can Whip Inflation and Build Back Better
summary: Rising prices are a serious problem, but so are the chronic challenges that the bill aims to confront.. The U.S. economy faces multiple challenges. The recovery has been more rapid than expected but now there's an acute inflation problem. At the same time, the economy suffers from chronic problems, including underinvestment in children, insufficient support for working parents, and the threat of climate change. Addressing inflation is imperative, especially through less-expansionary monetary policy. But Congress must also address the chronic problems by passing the Build Back Better bill.

title: Cuba's Government Deploys Security Forces to Prevent Protest
summary: Authorities detain activists and militants gather at the homes of organizers to stifle pro-democracy rallies. Cuba's government deployed security forces in large numbers to repress a planned protest demanding democracy that has unsettled the regime, in the latest sign of rising social discontent fueled by an economic crisis.

title: Los Angeles Home Lists for $24.95 Million
summary: Owner Steven Schwartz of aircraft brokerage Aerista worked with interior designer Adam Hunter to decorate the custom home. A fully furnished home in the Los Angeles neighborhood of Brentwood is hitting the market for $24.95 million.

title: Labor Groups Press for Biden's Covid-19 Vaccine Mandate to Go Further
summary: AFL-CIO, UFCW and SEIU 32BJ all filed petitions asking for the policy to be reviewed; some say they want it to apply to smaller companies. Three labor organizations are calling on the Biden administration to review its Covid-19 vaccine mandate, with some indicating the policy is too limited in applying to only large businesses.

title: Inflation Surge Pushes Gold to Five-Month High
summary: Climb in the haven asset accompanies other signs that investors are starting to seek more protection from rising consumer prices and interest rates. Gold prices have surged near their highest level in five months, a sign of growing unease that inflation will slow the economy and undercut the stock market's steady run up.

title: Biden Signs $1 Trillion Infrastructure Bill Into Law
summary: Legislation is largest federal investment in infrastructure in more than a decade. WASHINGTON-President Biden signed into law a roughly $1 trillion infrastructure bill to repair the nation's aging roads and bridges, upgrade the electrical grid and expand access to broadband internet.

title: Ohio Sues Meta Over Impact on Children
summary: Lawsuit filed on behalf of Meta investors and Ohio Public Employees Retirement System seeks to recover more than $100 billion. Ohio's attorney general is suing Meta Platforms Inc., formerly known as Facebook Inc., alleging the company misled the public about how it controlled its algorithm and the effects its products have on children.

summary: IATSE says 50.3% of voting members approved three-year contracts, avoiding shutdown of film and TV production sets. LOS ANGELES-A union representing tens of thousands of the entertainment industry's behind-the-scenes workers narrowly ratified contracts with Hollywood studios on Monday, ending a contentious chapter that put the industry on the brink of a strike.

summary: The Venezuelan conductor, whose career has been taking off lately, had his debut with the Philadelphia Orchestra on Thursday, leading a bill of Berlioz, Dvořák and Jacob Bancks..

title: Trump Ally Steve Bannon Surrenders to FBI
summary: Former White House strategist says he will 'go on the offense' in fighting charges of contempt of Congress. WASHINGTON-Former Trump strategist Steve Bannon surrendered to law enforcement Monday and was released on his own recognizance, days after a federal grand jury indicted him on criminal contempt of Congress charges for defying a subpoena from the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol.

title: Muni Bond Prices Rally After Infrastructure Bill Leaves Out Market
summary: Yield on a 10-year tax-exempt triple-A muni bond has fallen 8% since Oct. 28. Municipal bond prices rallied over the past two weeks as investors abandoned hopes for a flurry of new bonds from Congress's $1 trillion investment in U.S. infrastructure.

summary: Dollar Tree surges after report of activist investor; global oil market benchmark falls. U.S. stocks slipped to start the week, with investors parsing how companies might withstand inflation pressures.

summary: Agreement requires online retail giant to end practices that California's attorney general said concealed Covid case counts. California said it has secured an agreement with Amazon . com Inc. to rectify how the company handled Covid-19 notifications to warehouse workers and local health agencies.

title: Alex Jones Liable by Default in Sandy Hook Defamation Cases
summary: Connecticut ruling comes after far-right radio host failed to produce court-ordered discovery. Alex Jones will be responsible for financial damages to several families of victims of the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting who accused the far-right radio host and provocateur of propagating lies that the tragedy was a hoax, a Connecticut judge ruled Monday.

title: What's in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill
summary: Roughly $1 trillion law is key part of President Biden's agenda. President Biden has signed into law a roughly $1 trillion infrastructure package, which includes about $550 billion above projected federal spending on roads, bridges, expanded broadband access and more.

title: U.K. Raises Terrorist Threat Level After Liverpool Taxi Explosion
summary: Investigators were working to determine whether anyone else was involved in the Sunday incident. LONDON-Britain's government raised the country's nationwide terrorist threat level to severe on Monday after a would-be attacker in Liverpool killed himself when he detonated an explosive device in the back of a taxi a day earlier.

title: Oatly Shares Fall on Sales Warning
summary: Company backed by celebrities like Oprah Winfrey and Jay-Z lowers sales outlook. Swedish oat-milk maker Oatly Group AB warned that production challenges might keep it from growing as fast as previously projected, sending its shares lower on Monday.

title: Who Will Get Blamed for Wasted Infrastructure Spending?
summary: Buttigieg and Harris well positioned to evade accountability.. President Joe Biden knows better than anyone how much money can be lost when Washington embarks on a historic effort to build and repair U.S. infrastructure. This may be why he has constructed a new bureaucratic infrastructure enabling his political heirs to dodge accountability for today's spending. This column generally avoids making political predictions but is confident in guaranteeing that another president will soon be promising another costly fix for roads and bridges.

title: Beto O'Rourke Announces Bid for Texas Governor
summary: Democrat O'Rourke, who lost run to unseat Sen. Ted Cruz in 2018, to challenge Gov. Greg Abbott next year. AUSTIN, Texas-Beto O'Rourke, the former Democratic U.S. presidential candidate, said he is running for governor of Texas, setting up a face-off next year in the nation's second-largest state against a historically popular Republican governor many of whose policies have moved right over the course of his tenure.

title: Belarus Border Standoff Prompts Broader EU Sanctions
summary: EU foreign ministers agree to impose fresh measures on officials and companies. BRUSSELS-The European Union agreed to broaden its sanctions regime against Belarus over the migrant border standoff, brushing off threats by President Alexander Lukashenko to cut gas flows to the continent.

title: TerraCycle Partners to Change Recycling Labels After Settling Lawsuit
summary: The recycling startup is paid by consumer-goods brands to recycle plastic packaging, but some shoppers aren't able to access its program when they want to throw their waste away. Some of the world's biggest consumer-goods companies agreed to change their U.S. recycling labels for some products after reaching a settlement with an anti-plastic group that said they misled shoppers about the scope of a recycling initiative.

title: Roblox Looks to Bring Educational Videogames to Schools
summary: Company is starting with $10 million investment for nonprofits to develop games, its first such funding. Roblox Corp. plans to help bring educational videogames to classrooms world-wide, part of its strategy to expand its mostly teen and preteen user base and play a role in the next evolution of the internet known as the metaverse.

title: U.S. Infrastructure Struggles With New Weather Forecast
summary: Resume Subscription. A 22-foot-high floodwall was supposed to protect Aqua Pennsylvania's water-treatment facility near the Schuylkill River from a 100-year storm. But when the remains of Hurricane Ida barreled through the area near Philadelphia in September, the 18-inch-thick wall proved no match for the record rains.

title: Sen. Patrick Leahy Says He Won't Run for Re-Election in 2022
summary: The Vermont Democrat has served in the Senate for decades; 'time to put down the gavel'. WASHINGTON-Sen. Patrick Leahy (D., Vt.), the longest-serving lawmaker in the Senate and the chairman of the Appropriations Committee, on Monday said he won't run for re-election next year.

title: Police Have Tool to Take Guns From Potential Shooters, but Many Aren't Using It
summary: Red-flag laws have been used only a handful of times in New York City, Chicago and Hawaii, but thousands of times in Florida. The most broadly adopted gun-control measure in the U.S. in recent years is rarely being used in many cities and counties, government data show.

title: Shell to Move Headquarters to London Amid Energy Transition
summary: Oil giant to simplify dual British and Dutch structure, as it tries to make the company easier to value during its shift to lower-carbon assets. LONDON- Royal Dutch Shell PLC plans to consolidate its dual British and Dutch structure and relocate its headquarters to London, a move it said would help facilitate returns to shareholders and make it simpler to change up its portfolio of assets.

title: Tyson Foods Raises Meat Prices as Costs Escalate
summary: Meat giant says it increased its average beef prices by one-third in its most recent quarter. Tyson Foods Inc. reported a jump in sales after sharply raising prices for its beef, chicken and pork, citing growing costs the company said were likely to persist.

title: Left-Leaning Media Seek a Misinformation Monopoly
summary: They peddle their own falsehoods while trying to drive opposing views out of circulation entirely.. Kyle Rittenhouse is a domestic terrorist. Brett Kavanaugh is a rapist. Donald Trump won in 2016 only because he colluded with the Kremlin. Nick Sandmann, the boy from Covington Catholic High School on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial, was an entitled white bigot. Mr. Trump said the neo-Nazis at Charlottesville were "good people." Last year's riots were mostly peaceful. Unarmed black men are routinely shot in huge numbers by police officers. The discovery of Hunter Biden's laptop was a Russian plot.

title: Nearly $50 Million Home Outside Palm Springs has Three Pools and a Shark Tank
summary: The sculptural house belonged to Duane Hagadone, builder of the Coeur d'Alene Golf & Spa Resort. In Palm Desert, Calif., a sprawling and futuristic mansion with asymmetrical walls and a curved copper roof is hitting the market for $49.5 million.

title: Biden Administration Seeks to Limit Drilling Around Chaco Canyon
summary: Interior Department to consider 20-year ban on new oil and gas leasing near New Mexico cultural site. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration is taking steps to block oil and gas leasing within a 10-mile radius around New Mexico's Chaco Canyon, a site considered sacred to Native Americans.

title: Airbus Wins First Order for New Freighter
summary: Order from Air Lease for seven cargo variants of A350 marks Airbus's push into market long dominated by Boeing. DUBAI- Airbus SE booked its first order for a newly launched wide-body freighter, pushing into a market dominated by rival Boeing Co. at a time when air cargo is booming.

title: EU Sanctions Russia's Wagner Group to Thwart Private Military
summary: Mercenaries with suspected Kremlin ties are accused by U.S. and allies of profiting from chaos; Moscow denies link. BRUSSELS-European Union foreign ministers agreed to impose sanctions on Russian mercenary company Wagner Group, French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said Monday, as European diplomats warned that the company poses a growing threat to EU interests.

title: Don't Settle: Biden Has No Business Paying Illegal-Immigrant Families
summary: Separation was a risk that families assumed when they attempted illegal entry. No court should grant them damages.. Regarding Peter Wallison's op-ed "Will Biden 'Sue and Settle' at the Border?" (Nov. 11): "Sue and settle" litigation initiated by the ACLU for families that were separated when they tried to enter the U.S. illegally should be countered by Justice Department lawyers in the Biden administration (as it probably would have been by the Trump administration) with a defense that any first-year law student would recognize from a class in torts: assumption of the risk.

title: Some Free California Tax Advice for Elon Musk
summary: The Golden State will want its share of the Texas resident's capital gain on Tesla stock.. Elon Musk should pay heed to Dan Molinski's op-ed "When California Snatched My Paycheck" (Nov. 4). Mr. Musk, now a Texas resident, has lately sold nearly $7 billion in Tesla stock. California will soon send Mr. Musk a bill, taxing him on almost 85% of the gain from the sale. If he continues to sell stock, consistent with the result of his Twitter poll, he should expect a California tax bill of close to $3 billion.

title: China Left in Shock Following Brutal Killing of Corgi During Covid-19 Disinfection
summary: Video of epidemic-prevention workers beating pet dog prompts outcry in country sticking with 'Covid Zero' policy. HONG KONG-The fatal beating of a pet corgi by epidemic prevention workers disinfecting a residential building linked to a Covid-19 outbreak in southeastern China has sparked outrage in China, leading some pet owners and animal rights activists to question the extent of China's stringent pandemic-control measures.

title: Valuing the Softer Side of Business Education
summary: It pays to know your customers.. In "Should Aspiring Entrepreneurs Major in Business?" (Journal Report, Nov. 4), John Sullivan suggests that business founders need specific skills. As a business owner, I agree. But I disagree that a college business program necessarily provides those skills.

title: Can You Criticize the Schools in Public?
summary: The threats and accusations against parents in Virginia in a small way echoed what I experienced years ago in Hungary.. Attorney General Merrick Garland has threatened protesting parents, accusing them of endangering school-board members ("Virginia's 'Phony' Culture War" by William McGurn, Main Street, Nov. 9). Growing up in Communist Hungary, we would have family discussions in which we frequently criticized teachers and curriculums. But our discussions invariably ended with my father telling us to be careful outside our home, and never to make critical statements about the government, teachers or communist propaganda. Open public discussions had dangerous consequences, sometimes imprisonment. The threats and accusations against parents in Virginia in a small way echoed what I experienced years ago. Fortunately, elections are wonderful equalizers for social ailments. Congratulations, Virginia.

title: Dollar Tree Shake-Up Was Long Overdue
summary: Activist Mantle Ridge will have a tough job closing the gap with Dollar General. An activist investor thinks shareholders should get more bang for their buck at Dollar Tree . Shareholders seem to agree.

title: Is That Kosher? Rabbis Debate Plant-Based 'Pork'
summary: Resume Subscription. TEL AVIV-It might look like pork, smell like pork, even taste like pork-just don't call it pork.

title: Will Anyone Watch a TV Show About Streetwear? Amazon's 'Fairfax' Is Betting Yes.
summary: Amazon Prime's new adult animated series takes aim at sneaker obsessing and hoodie hoarding. But the show may be too niche for its own good.. In the premiere episode of Amazon Prime's new animated show "Fairfax," a group of clout-hungry teenagers attempts to track down a limited-edition T-shirt from Latrine, a fictional streetwear brand that is a thinly veiled sendup of Supreme. The show is overstuffed with knowing references to hype-happy streetwear in the real world: The animated quartet name-drops Grailed, a resale site; the characters lust after decade-plus-old Nike Dunks; and the shirt they're after carries Dr. Phil's face, a nod to head-scratcher Supreme collaborations which featured images of Kermit the Frog or Shrek.

title: The 1970s Are Calling
summary: They want their economic policy back.. The 2020s feel like a reprise of the 1970s ("Inflation and Building Back Worse," Review & Outlook, Nov. 11). Hatred of Donald Trump was Nixon derangement syndrome on steroids. The departure from Vietnam was similar to the abandonment of Afghanistan. The '70s protests weren't unlike Black Lives Matter marches. Democrats control Congress and Jimmy Carter stands in for Joe Biden. The '70s economic mess ultimately paved the way for Ronald Reagan. Today, we need a Reagan clone to tell Washington the 1970s are calling and want their economic policy back.

title: Shell Leaves Behind Its Century-Old Dutch Identity
summary: Oil giant breaks with Dutch roots as it seeks to pivot to greener energy. Royal Dutch Shell PLC's plan to consolidate its share structure, move its headquarters to London and drop Royal Dutch from its name would end its identity as an Anglo-Dutch company after more than a century.

summary: Real-estate investment trust CyrusOne designs, builds and operates data centers. CyrusOne Inc. said Monday that it is selling itself to buyout firms KKR & Co. and Global Infrastructure Partners LLC in a deal valued at about $15 billion including debt.

summary: Resume Subscription. Over a sleepy weekend in late August, entrepreneur and business author Gary Vaynerchuk racked up more than one million preorders of his coming book. It was one of the industry's biggest advance orders for a single title in a 24-hour period.

summary: Oil and gas giant wants to unify its corporate structure in the U.K., raising investor expectations for share buybacks and deals to take it into the green-energy era. Royal Dutch Shell is giving up its Dutch crown to become a more agile English commoner. It is good news for investors, though it would have been better news if the company had jumped before it was shoved.

title: In a New Constitution, the NCAA Reduces the Power of a Key Player: Itself
summary: The association is expected to take the first steps toward adopting a new constitution that hands more power to its three divisions. The National College Athletics Association had a brutal summer. It lost a landmark case in the Supreme Court that loosened its tight grip over college sports. It endured scrutiny from federal lawmakers amid a flurry of state laws that did away with the association's longtime ban on college athletes making money on their likeness.

title: Revolutionary Change or Practical Help? Democrats Struggle With the Difference
summary: A philosophical split within the Democratic Party is plaguing legislators' efforts to pass the Biden agenda. title: Airbnb Fans Should Check Out Old-School Rival Expedia
summary: Long-term travel is here now, but not necessarily here to stay. title: Market Bets on a Fed Interest-Rate Mistake
summary: Some indicators say the market expects a rapid rise in rates from the Federal Reserve, and others suggest the opposite. It still makes sense.. But the market is also saying that rates won't go as high as the Fed eventually thinks they will.

title: Heineken Looks to Tap Growth in Africa With Duo of Deals

title: Schools Embrace More Covid-19 Testing Over Quarantine to Keep Kids in Class
summary: Resume Subscription. Grant Rivera spent 18 months struggling to conduct school safely during the pandemic before he stumbled upon an op-ed describing a way to keep children in class by testing them frequently for Covid-19.

title: Ocean Shipping Rates Fall but Ports Are Still Jammed
summary: Cost to ship a container across the Pacific declined by more than one-quarter last week, signaling demand is finally easing. The cost to move a container across the Pacific fell by more than one-quarter last week, the biggest decline in two years. The decline signals that the huge demand for Asian exports is easing, though shipping executives say it will be months before the logjam of ships outside of U.S. ports clears up.

title: Biden Weighs Choice of Jerome Powell or Lael Brainard as Fed Chair
summary: The two candidates have offered similar views on inflation and interest rates this year, indicating that policy continuity is likely. President Biden is expected to decide as soon as this week whether to appoint Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell or governor Lael Brainard to a four-year term leading the central bank beginning next February.

title: Democrats Fear Steep Losses in 2022 Midterm House Races
summary: Biden's low poll numbers, a poor showing in Virginia and historical trends all point to Democrats struggling to keep their majority, analysts say. WASHINGTON-Alarm bells are ringing in the Democratic Party as it prepares to defend its narrow House majority in the 2022 midterm elections.

title: WTA Calls for Investigation Into Peng Shuai Sexual-Assault Allegations Against a Former Chinese Leader
summary: Women's Tennis Association chairman calls for issue to be handled "without censorship," risking backlash from Beijing. The Women's Tennis Association called on the Chinese government to investigate allegations of sexual assault against a former senior official posted on the social media account of professional tennis star Peng Shuai, risking backlash in a country that has punished foreign sports organizations for wading into its domestic politics.

title: China Posts Robust Growth in Factory Output and Consumer Spending
summary: New signs of weakness in real estate highlight concerns about economic outlook. BEIJING-Chinese factory activity and consumer spending were surprisingly robust in October, official monthly figures showed Monday, though fresh signs of weakness in the property sector underscored concerns for the outlook of the world's second-largest economy.

title: Ping. Ding. Chirp. Notifications Are Driving Us Crazy.
summary: With workplace tools multiplying and personal messages creeping in, it can be hard to get anything done. Wait, what was that one?

title: M.B.A. Starting Salaries Are Soaring
summary: Employers are willing to pay a premium to lure business-school graduates in a tight labor market. Pay for business-school graduates rebounded to new heights this year after flatlining early in the pandemic.

title: International Student Enrollment Rises at U.S. Colleges
summary: New enrollments by foreign students jump 68%; total number of international students is up 4%. International-student enrollment in U.S. colleges and universities is showing signs of a rebound this fall after plummeting when the pandemic pushed classes online last year and the Trump administration all but closed the nation's borders.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Corrections & Amplifications
summary: Resume Subscription. Rivian Automotive Inc. in 2017 acquired a former Mitsubishi Motors Corp. factory in Normal, Ill., from Maynards Industries. A Nov. 6 Exchange article about Rivian, an electric-truck startup, incorrectly said the plant was purchased from Mitsubishi Corp. An Aug. 28 Business News article about Rivian also misidentified the plant and misspelled Mitsubishi Corp. as Mitsuishi.

title: Defensive Position (Monday Crossword, November 15)
